result.execSummary:
The defendant CHRISTOPHER A. NIGL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office immediately. Failure to do so shall result in a Judgment being placed against the Defendant for any outstanding amount.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and fingerprints and photograph pursuant to Wis. Stats. 970.02(7).  IMMEDIATELY following court, contact (920) 236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  Arrangements to complete collection shall be made within 72 hours.  At time of appointment, Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CHRISTOPHER A. NIGL

records.addlTxt: 10:07 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER A. NIGL in court.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. State advises that victim impact statement is on file.  Judge advises that he has reviewed the statement.  As Marcy's law is complied with, can move forward to sentencing.  Defendant advised of, and waives rights.  Plea agreement entered onto court record for a fine plus costs.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  Judge questions Defendant.  Court finds that due to counseling the defendant has completed, that he will now have a criminal conviction and that there are restraining orders in place, that a fine and costs is appropriate.

9:08 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER A. NIGL in court.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily.  State advises victim rights are not in compliance.  Sentencing hearing adjourned.

9:08 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER A. NIGL in court.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Advised of and waives rights.  Copy of complaint received by Def.  Plea entered.  Marcy's law complied with.  State's offer = $200 fine + costs to resolve matter.  Defendant accepts offer.  Court confirms address and phone number.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  Court releases defendant on his own recognize.
to appear on Tuesday, October 18, 2022 at 9:00 am - Branch 2
